note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
name: Downtime
tagline: jQuery plugin for customisable timers and timed events
body:
### What is it?
Put it simply, its a count(down|up) timer plugin.

### Why should I use it?
Because. No really, the plugin is purely programatic. Youâ€™re free to use whatever markup you wish. Just add `data-bind="hours"`, `data-bind="minutes"`, and `data-bind="seconds"` to have the timer automatically update your content.

Alternatively you could just bind to the `downtime.update` and handle the lot yourself.
